4. User should be able to create

title: Verify the package sale & offer sale by creating a package with Force Fixed Seat Quantity as true

9. Select the delivery method

11. Logout of the application

2. Pre Requsite should be set successfully
3. The Ticket Sales portal should be opened
4. The Package should be selected and its seats should be displayed.
5. The seats should be added to the cart successfully
6. The Package should be selected and its seats should be displayed.
7. The seats should be added to the cart successfully
8. Cart Should be displayed
9. Delivery method should be applied
10. Transaction number should diaplay to the user
11. The application should be successfully logged out.
12. The Patron should be successfully added.

title: Perform partial package exchange transaction - system error

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Launch PV application
2. Complete a transaction using package
3. Note down the transaction ID
2. Launch PV application
3. Login as BO user
4. select ticket services from the drop down
5. 1. Enter the transaction ID noted and open the Transaction details
6. 1. select partial exchange from the select action drop down
2. Select one or two ticket and click on APPLY ACTION button
7. Search and select a package event
8. Click on the best available

title: Package Access_Transaction Types and Dates_Date Override_Verfiy that lower permissions always load with the Sale access not the previous permission access

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to Application with Valid Credential
2. Navigates to Package Admin portal and select an event
3. Select Package Access tab.
4. Seelct the option "Transaction Types and Dates" from the dropdown
5. Select agency from the context
6. Permission Grouping->Full Package->Package Return

1.Uncheck 'Inherit'.  Date range values default to inherited values.
2.Deselect 'Allow'.  Dates are nullified.
3.Re-select 'Allow.' Dates default to the same as the sales permission.
4.Reselect 'Inherit'.  Dates revert back to inherited values.
7. Permission Grouping->Full Package->Package Exchange

1.Uncheck 'Inherit'.  Date range values default to inherited values.
2.Deselect 'Allow'.  Dates are nullified.
3.Re-select 'Allow.' Dates default to the same as the sales permission.
4.Reselect 'Inherit'.  Dates revert back to inherited values.
8. Permission Grouping->Full Package->Package Reservation

1.Uncheck 'Inherit'.  Date range values default to inherited values.
2.Deselect 'Allow'.  Dates are nullified.
3.Re-select 'Allow.' Dates default to the same as the sales permission.
4.Reselect 'Inherit'.  Dates revert back to inherited values.
9. Permission Grouping->Full Package->Package Release

1.Uncheck 'Inherit'.  Date range values default to inherited values.
2.Deselect 'Allow'.  Dates are nullified.
3.Re-select 'Allow.' Dates default to the same as the sales permission.
4.Reselect 'Inherit'.  Dates revert back to inherited values.
10. Package Access > Partial Package

Verfiy it for Package Access > Partial Package ticket exchange

& Partial Package Seat Upgrade
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should be logged in successfully
2. Package admin portal should be loaded.
3. Package access tab should be selected.
4. user must able to select "Transaction Types and Dates" from the dropdown
5. Agency should be selected successfully
6. For each action date range should change accordingly 
if Allow is then deselected and the dates clear, reselecting Allow should then reload with the 'Sale' permissions, not the inherited permissions. Reselecting Inherit would reload the inherited values.
7. For each action date range should change accordingly 
if Allow is then deselected and the dates clear, reselecting Allow should then reload with the 'Sale' permissions, not the inherited permissions. Reselecting Inherit would reload the inherited values.
8. For each action date range should change accordingly 
if Allow is then deselected and the dates clear, reselecting Allow should then reload with the 'Sale' permissions, not the inherited permissions. Reselecting Inherit would reload the inherited values.
9. For each action date range should change accordingly 
if Allow is then deselected and the dates clear, reselecting Allow should then reload with the 'Sale' permissions, not the inherited permissions. Reselecting Inherit would reload the inherited values.
10. If the PP Ticket Exchange and/or Seat Upgrade permissions are Allowed at the current level their dates should default to the same date permissions as the PP Ticket Return value.

title: Verify that the search result of a partial exchange and complete deferred exchange does not list the events of the package being exchanged when reverse permission is not allowed and sale permission is allowed for this package

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Launch the PV application 
Username : xxxx
Password : xxxx
2. Create an event (Multiple events)
3.Create Package event list (mutiple) and add the events to PEL's
4.Create a package and add the PEL's to the package
5.Go to pakage access tab
6.Go to Reserve\release\claim seats ,the reserve seats should be checked and sale should be checked
2. 1. Go to ticket sales portal 
2. Search for a package
3. 1.Lock the seats 
2. Reserve the seats
4. 1.Click on that confirmation link
2.Transaction details page will be displayed
3. Navigate to order details tab
5. Uncheck reserve permission check box from Reserve\release\claim seats 
1. Select seats from one of the event
2.select Partail Exchange from the Actions drop down
3. Clcik on apply changes
4.Complete a transaction
6. 1. Select seats for different event
2.Click on Partail Exchange from the Actions drop down
3.Clcik on apply action
7. 1. Use " wil card * " to search
2.The desired package will be displyed in the 'event partial package search'  feild
8. 1. Cancel the Exchange 
2. Go to order details tab and enter the order number.
9. 1.Click on 'Complete deferred exchange' from the drop down of Actions
2.Select the deferred event
3.Clcik on apply action
10. 1. Use " wil card * " to search
2.The desired package should not get displyed in the 'event partial package search'  feild
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User must able to login successfully and the pre requisite should be successfull
2. User shuld able to search for a Package successfully
3. User able to complete a transaction
4. User should be able to navigate to order details page
5. The events of this package is not displayed in the search result, User must able to complete the transaction successfully
6. User should be able to reload the order details again and complete the transaction successfully
7. The events of this package is not displayed in the search result
8. User able to navigae to order details tab and able to reload the order number again successfully
9. System Navigate to the Package-Details tab
10. The events of this package is not displayed in the search result

title: Verify exchagne and complete deferred exchange search when user has at least EITHER sales OR reserve seats access to a package in order to display search results

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Launch the PV application 
Username : xxxx

2.select Partail Exchange from the Actions drop down

2. Create Season
3. Create Series
4. Create  Package Run                   5. Create Organization                  6. Create Agency
5. Create User
2. Launch the PV Application.
3. Login the Application using the suitable credentials


4. 1. Navigate to the Supplier administration portal through Ticketing set up
2. Enter the Supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Package Access tab.
5. 1. Select "Series " from "Set Access For" dropdown.
2. Enter the Series created in Step4 in search criteria and click on find button. 
3. Click on the Channel link.
4. Verify if the " Package Ticket sale" is checked or not        If it is unchecked, then check it and enter the Dates in the date feild displayed
6. 1. Select "Series " from "Set Access For" dropdown.
2. Enter the Series created in Step4 in search criteria and click on find button. 
3. Click on the Agency link.
4. Verify if the " Package Ticket sale" is checked and Valid Dates are displayed
7. 1. Select "Series " from "Set Access For" dropdown.
2. Enter the Series created in Step4 in search criteria and click on find button. 
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the " Package Ticket sale" is checked and Valid Dates are displayed
8. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page.
2. Enter the package created in step9  in Search criteria and click on find button. 
3.. Select the Package Access tab.
4. Click on the channel link.
5. Verify if the "Package Ticket sale" is checked and Valid Dates are displayed
9. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page. Enter the Package created in Step9 in search criteria and click on find button. 
2. Select the Package Access tab.
3. Click on the Agency link.
4. Verify if the "Package Ticket sale" is checked and Valid Dates are displayed
10. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page. Enter the Package created in Step9 in search criteria and click on find button.
2. Select the Package Access tab.
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the "Package Ticket sale" is checked and Valid Dates are displayed
11. 1. Navigate to the Ticket sales portal through Ticketing set up tab in the home page.
2. Select the above created package.
3. Perform a sales Transaction
12. Case 1: The current date(The Date on which the sale is performed) falls between the dates mentioned in Valid dates in Ticket sale field in Ticket sale/Return vertical tab
13. Case 2: The current date(The Date on which the sale is performed) does not fall between the dates mentioned in Valid dates in Ticket sale field in Ticket sale/Return vertical tab
14. Logout of the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. The user should be able to launch the application successfully
3. The user should be able to login the application successfully
4. 1. Package access for the supplier level should be displayed.
2. "Set Access for" dropdown should have Default value as "Supplier"
5. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
6. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
7. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
8. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
9. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
10. " Package Ticket sale" should be checked and valid dates should be displayed.
11. 
12. The user should be able to perform the sales transaction
13. The user should not be able to perform the sales transaction
14. The user should be able to logout of the application successfully

title: Verify Override Allow Anonymous Sales in  Suppliers Channel level of Supplier administration and verify through the Package administration user level

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Create Event
2. Create Package Event List
3. Include event into Package List
3. Create Package
4. Include package Event List into Package
5. Create Season
6. Create Series
7. Create Event Run
8. Create User
2. Launch PVNG using the Following Credentials.



3. Select Supplier Administration from Ticket Setup
4. Select Package Access Portal in Supplier Administration
5. Select Supplier from  Set Access Drop Down List
6. Click on Channel Level
7. 1.Enter Channel Name & Click on Find
2.Overide/Uncheck Allow Anonymous in Supplier-Channel Level
8. 1. Enter Agency Name & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Supplier-Agency Level
9. 1. Enter User Name & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Supplier-User Level
10. Select Season from  Set Access Drop Down List
11. 1. Enter Channel Name & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in  Season-Channel Level
12. 1. Enter Agency Name & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in  Season- Agency Level
13. 1. Enter  User Name & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Season - User Level
14. Select Series from  Set Access Drop Down List
15. 1. Enter Channel & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Series- Channel Level
16. 1. Enter Agency & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Series-Agency  Level
17. 1. Enter User & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Series-User  Level
18. Select Package from Package Administration
19. Select Package Access Portal in Package
20. 1. Enter channel & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Package- Channel  Level
21. 1. Enter Agency & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Package-Agency Level
22. 1. Enter User & Click on Find

2. Verify Allow Anonymous Sales inherited in Package- User Level
23. Navigate to Ticket sales
24. Perform Ticket sales for Package that already set in pre-requiste
1. Select Packate to sale
2. Ticket Sale
3. Delivery Method
4. Accept Payment
5. Check Out
25. Log out the PV Application

title: Verify if the Inheritance for Package Access Admin is working properly From the Supplier Administration Package User level through the Package Admin User level for Allow Anonymous Sales

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the PV Application.
2. Login the Application using the suitable credentials


3. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Season tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields 
6. Click on Apply changes
4. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Series tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields and Enter the Season as the season created above.
6. Click on Apply changes.
5. 1. Navigate to the Packages through Ticketing set up tab in home page.
2. Create a package with the above mentioned supplier, season, Series
6. 1. Navigate to the Supplier administration portal through Ticketing set up
2. Enter the Supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Package Access tab.
7. 1. Check the Allow Anonymous Sales Check box under Allow Anonymous Sales
2.Click on Apply changes button
8. 1. Select "Series " from "Set Access For" dropdown.
2. Enter the Series created in Step4 in search criteria and click on find button. 
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the " Allow Anonymous Sales" is checked 
5.Uncheck the "Allow Anonymous Sales" 
6. Click on apply changes
9. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page. Enter the Package created in Search criteria and click on find button.
2. Select the Package Access tab.
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the "Allow Anonymous Sales"
10. 1. Navigate to the Ticket sales portal through Ticketing set up tab in the home page.
2. Select the above created package.
3. Perform a sales Transaction without a patron
11. Logout of the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The user should be able to launch the application successfully
2. The user should be able to login the application successfully
3. The user should be able to create a new season successfully
4. The user should be able to create a new Series successfully
5. The user should be able to create the package successfully.
6. 1. Package access for the supplier level should be displayed.
2. "Set Access for" dropdown should have Default value as "Supplier"
7. The Allow Anonymous Sales check box should be checked.
8. " Allow Anonymous Sales" should be checked
9. " Allow Anonymous Sales" should be unchecked
10. The user should be able to perform the sales transaction
11. The user should be able to logout of the application successfully

title: Verify if the Inheritance for Package Access Admin is working properly when overridden at the Package Admin User level

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Create an Agency and a User.
2.Login using that User and Create a Package with atleast one event associated with it.
2. Launch the PV Application.
3. Login the Application using the suitable credentials


4. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Season tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields 
6. Click on Apply changes
5. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Series tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields and Enter the Season as the season created above.
6. Click on Apply changes.
6. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page. Enter the Package created in Step9 in search criteria and click on find button.
2. Select the Package Access tab.
3. Click on the User link.
4. Check the Package Ticket sale Check box under Package Ticket sale/Return Vertical tab. Enter the Valid Dates.
5.Click on Apply changes button
7. 1. Navigate to the Ticket sales portal through Ticketing set up tab in the home page.
2. Select the above created package.
3. Perform a sales Transaction
8. Case 1: The current date(The Date on which the sale is performed) falls between the dates mentioned in Valid dates in Ticket sale field in Ticket sale/Return vertical tab
9. Case 2: The current date(The Date on which the sale is performed) does not fall between the dates mentioned in Valid dates in Ticket sale field in Ticket sale/Return vertical tab
10. Logout of the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Package cretaed successfully.
2. The user should be able to launch the application successfully
3. The user should be able to login the application successfully
4. The user should be able to create a new season successfully
5. The user should be able to create a new Series successfully
6. The Package Ticket Sale check box should be checked.
Valid dates should be displayed.
7. 
8. The user should be able to perform the sales transaction
9. The user should not be able to perform the sales transaction
10. The user should be able to logout of the application successfully

title: Lock package seats through PID checker prior to event being onsale and with no reservation permission

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Note down the PVO supplier, package subagency set up for the current PV version
2. Launch PV application using URL : and login using valid credentials
3. 1. select package Administration from the ticketing menu drop down
2. Click  on NEW button to create a new event
3. Enter the required fields. Enter a future date as event date for ex: 06/14/2010 10:00 AM
4. Click on Apply changes
4. 1. Navigate to package access 
2. Set the onsale dates as 06/13/2010 10:00 AM 
3. Click on apply changes
5. 1. Click on the Reserve/Release/Claim Single Seats
2. Deselect the checkbox corresponding to Reserve Seats, Claim seats, Release Seats
(if the inherit checkbox is checked, unselect the inherit checkbox and deselect the checkboxes corresponding to reserve/claim/release seats)
3. Click on APPLY CHANGES button
6. Logout from the application
7. 1. Open PVO Maintenance site:
2. Login using valid credentials
8. 1. Click on the Run Pokemon perf accept under Operation from the menu
2. Select the supplier and sub agency combination noted in the precondition.
3. Enter the Package ID as the Supplier Perf Code 
4. Click on Run Pokemon Perf accept
9. 1. Launch PID Checker
2. Under Availability(price Groups and discounts) section, select any number of tickets under any price scale
3. Click the corresponding Go
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Login should be successful.
3. event should be created
4. Changes made should be saved
5. The changes made should be saved.
6. User should be logged out
7. Login to PVO maintenance site
8. Package should be perf accepted in PVo and Perf ID should be perf accepted
9. User should be navigated to the Lock Best Seats page and the order ID and other details related to the seats locked should be displayed to the user

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the PV Application.
2. Login the Application using the suitable credentials


3. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Season tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields 
6. Click on Apply changes
4. 1. Navigate to the Supplier Administration portal through Ticketing setup tab in homepage.
2. Enter the supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Event Groups Tab.
4. Select the Series tab.
5. Enter the mandatory fields and Enter the Season as the season created above.
6. Click on Apply changes.
5. 1. Navigate to the Packages through Ticketing set up tab in home page.
2. Create a package with the above mentioned supplier, season, Series
6. 1. Navigate to the Supplier administration portal through Ticketing set up
2. Enter the Supplier in the search criteria and click on find button.
3. Select the Package Access tab.
7. 1. Check the Allow Anonymous Sales Check box under Allow Anonymous Sales
2.Click on Apply changes button
8. 1. Select "Series " from "Set Access For" dropdown.
2. Enter the Series created in Step4 in search criteria and click on find button. 
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the " Allow Anonymous Sales" is checked 
5.Uncheck the "Allow Anonymous Sales" 
6. Click on apply changes
9. 1. Navigate to the Packages through ticketing set up tab in home page. Enter the Package created in Search criteria and click on find button.
2. Select the Package Access tab.
3. Click on the User link.
4. Verify if the "Allow Anonymous Sales"
10. 1. Navigate to the Ticket sales portal through Ticketing set up tab in the home page.
2. Select the above created package.
3. Perform a sales Transaction without a patron
11. Logout of the application

2. "Set Access for" dropdown should have Default value as "Supplier"
7. The Allow Anonymous Sales check box should be checked.
8. " Allow Anonymous Sales" should be checked
9. " Allow Anonymous Sales" should be unchecked
10. The user should be able to perform the sales transaction
11. The user should be able to logout of the application successfully

title: Lock package seats through PID checker prior to event being onsale and with no reservation permission

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Note down the PVO supplier, package subagency set up for the current PV version
2. Launch PV application using URL : and login using valid credentials
3. 1. select package Administration from the ticketing menu drop down
2. Click  on NEW button to create a new event
3. Enter the required fields. Enter a future date as event date for ex: 06/14/2010 10:00 AM
4. Click on Apply changes
4. 1. Navigate to package access 
2. Set the onsale dates as 06/13/2010 10:00 AM 
3. Click on apply changes
5. 1. Click on the Reserve/Release/Claim Single Seats
2. Deselect the checkbox corresponding to Reserve Seats, Claim seats, Release Seats
(if the inherit checkbox is checked, unselect the inherit checkbox and deselect the checkboxes corresponding to reserve/claim/release seats)
3. Click on APPLY CHANGES button
6. Logout from the application
7. 1. Open PVO Maintenance site:
2. Login using valid credentials
8. 1. Click on the Run Pokemon perf accept under Operation from the menu
2. Select the supplier and sub agency combination noted in the precondition.
3. Enter the Package ID as the Supplier Perf Code 
4. Click on Run Pokemon Perf accept
9. 1. Launch PID Checker
2. Under Availability(price Groups and discounts) section, select any number of tickets under any price scale
3. Click the corresponding Go
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Login should be successful.
3. event should be created
4. Changes made should be saved
5. The changes made should be saved.
6. User should be logged out
7. Login to PVO maintenance site
8. Package should be perf accepted in PVo and Perf ID should be perf accepted
9. User should be navigated to the Lock Best Seats page and the order ID and other details related to the seats locked should be displayed to the user
